Name: Podgorica
Description: Podgorica is the capital of Montenegro.

Name: Bar
Description: Bar is a major port for Montenegro.

Name: Budva
Description: Budva is a coastal tourist resort in Montenegro. It is often called "Montenegrin Miami", because it is the most crowded and most popular tourist resort in Montenegro, with beaches and vibrant nightlife.

Name: Cetinje
Description: Cetinje is the historic capital of Montenegro. The city is of enormous historical and spiritual value to Montenegro. During the siege of the Ottoman empire, Montenegro itself had, at numerous times, been reduced to just Cetinje and its surroundings.

Name: Kotor
Description: Kotor is a coastal town in Montenegro with a population of 23,500. It is known for its beautiful architecture and natural setting in the deepest part of a breathtaking bay.

Name: Nikšić
Description: Nikšić is the second largest city in Montenegro. In Nikšić proper there are a few sites to see but most of the really interesting places are located on the way to or from the city (such as the Ostrog Monastery).

Name: Tivat
Description: Tivat (Serbian Cyrillic: Тиват ; Italian: Teodo; Venetian: Teodo) is a coastal town in Montenegro in the Bay of Kotor.

Name: Žabljak
Description: Žabljak is small town in northern Montenegro, and is the centre of Montenegro's winter tourism.

Name: Ulcinj
Description: Ulcinj (Cyrillic: Улцињ, Albanian: Ulqin or Ulqini) is the most southern coastal town of Montenegro.

Name: Bečići
Description:
Bečići is a coastal tourist resort in Montenegro. Bečići is a tourist complex set behind the renowned Bečići Beach, near the historic town of Budva on Montenegro's Adriatic coast. It's a laid back location and the beautiful sandy beach and general amenities make it ideal for families. A centre for bathing and relaxation, it offers a wide range of water sports and other sporting facilities.
Bečići beach won the "Grand Prix" in Paris in 1935 as the most beautiful beach in Europe.

Name: Biogradska Gora National Park
Description: Biogradska Gora is in the Kolašin Municipality, in the North-Eastern part of Montenegro.

Name: Durmitor National Park
Description: Durmitor National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Montenegro.

Name: Lovćen National Park
Description: Lovćen National Park is in Central Montenegro, between Cetinje, Budva and Kotor. Its most significant attraction is the Mausoleum of Petar Petrović Njegoš, at the summit of Jezerski Vrh.

Name: Mount Ostrog
Description: Mount Ostrog is a monastery and site of pilgrimage in Central Montenegro.

Name: Perast
Description: Perast is a small city in Montenegro.

Name: Prokletije National Park
Description: Prokletije (Albanian: Alpet Shqiptare or Bjeshkët e Nemuna), sometimes called the Accursed Mountains are a range in Serbia, Kosovo, and northern Albania.

Name: Skadar Lake National Park
Description: Skadar Lake National Park is the Montenegrin side of Lake Skadar. It is the largest lake of the Balkans.

Name: Sveti Stefan
Description: Sveti Stefan  is a town in Montenegro. Previously a fishing village, in 1960 it was converted into the old town, with its tower, narrow streets, shops and small churches, remained unchanged.

Name: Bay of Kotor
Description: The Bay of Kotor (Montenegrin: Boka Kotorska) is a region of Montenegro. The bay, the city of Kotor and the  surrounding territory are a protected UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Name: Budva
Description: Budva is a coastal tourist resort in Montenegro. It is often called "Montenegrin Miami", because it is the most crowded and most popular tourist resort in Montenegro, with beaches and vibrant nightlife.
